about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: To make a right turn at a corner, you:

about.name: To make a right turn at a corner, you:

hasPart.assesses: To make a right turn at a corner, you: | To make a right turn at a corner, you: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When making a right turn where there is a bicycle lane, you must merge into the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner and then make the turn. Be sure there are no bicyclists in your path before merging.

suggestedAnswer.text: May not enter the bicycle lane.

comment.text: May not enter the bicycle lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Should only merge into the bicycle lane if you stop before turning.

comment.text: Should only merge into the bicycle lane if you stop before turning.

suggestedAnswer.text: Must merge into the bicycle lane before turning.

comment.text: Must merge into the bicycle lane before turning.

acceptedAnswer.text: Must merge into the bicycle lane before turning.

comment.text: Must merge into the bicycle lane before turning.

answerExplanation.text: When making a right turn where there is a bicycle lane, you must merge into the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner and then make the turn. Be sure there are no bicyclists in your path before merging.

comment.text: To make a right turn at a corner, you: | When making a right turn where there is a bicycle lane, you must merge into the bicycle lane no more than 200 feet before the corner and then make the turn. Be sure there are no bicyclists in your path before merging.

hasPart.name: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog:

about.name: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog:

hasPart.assesses: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog: | You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Pedestrians who use guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only when the guide dog is leading the person across the street.

comment.text: Only when the guide dog is leading the person across the street.
At all times.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only if a crossing guard is present.

comment.text: Only if a crossing guard is present.
At all times.

answerExplanation.text: Pedestrians who use guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

comment.text: You must yield to a pedestrian using a white cane or guide dog: | Pedestrians who use guide dogs or white canes (with or without a red tip) must be given the right-of-way at all times.

hasPart.name: You are coming to an intersection with a flashing red light. You should:

about.name: You are coming to an intersection with a flashing red light. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You are coming to an intersection with a flashing red light. You should: | You are coming to an intersection with a flashing red light. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A flashing red traffic light means the same thing as a stop sign. You must come to a complete stop, yield to other traffic and pedestrians, and then proceed when it safe to do so.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and yield the right-of-way.

comment.text: Slow down and yield the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and drive carefully through the intersection.

comment.text: Slow down and drive carefully through the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Come to a complete stop, check the traffic, and go when it is safe to do so.

comment.text: Come to a complete stop, check the traffic, and go when it is safe to do so.

acceptedAnswer.text: Come to a complete stop, check the traffic, and go when it is safe to do so.

comment.text: Come to a complete stop, check the traffic, and go when it is safe to do so.

answerExplanation.text: A flashing red traffic light means the same thing as a stop sign. You must come to a complete stop, yield to other traffic and pedestrians, and then proceed when it safe to do so.

comment.text: You are coming to an intersection with a flashing red light. You should: | A flashing red traffic light means the same thing as a stop sign. You must come to a complete stop, yield to other traffic and pedestrians, and then proceed when it safe to do so.

hasPart.name: This road sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This road sign means: | This road sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

comment.text: Do not enter.
No parking.
No U-turn.
No U-turn.

answerExplanation.text: This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

comment.text: This road sign means: | This sign prohibits drivers from making a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

hasPart.name: Placard abuse will result in:
hasPart.assesses: Placard abuse will result in: | Placard abuse will result in: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Abuse of a disabled placard or plate is a misdemeanor. Placard abuse can result in the loss of special parking privileges, a fine of up to $1,000, and up to six months of jail time.

comment.text: Placard revocation only.
Only a fine.

suggestedAnswer.text: Placard revocation, a fine, and/or jail time.

comment.text: Placard revocation, a fine, and/or jail time.

acceptedAnswer.text: Placard revocation, a fine, and/or jail time.

comment.text: Placard revocation, a fine, and/or jail time.

answerExplanation.text: Abuse of a disabled placard or plate is a misdemeanor. Placard abuse can result in the loss of special parking privileges, a fine of up to $1,000, and up to six months of jail time.

comment.text: Placard abuse will result in: | Abuse of a disabled placard or plate is a misdemeanor. Placard abuse can result in the loss of special parking privileges, a fine of up to $1,000, and up to six months of jail time.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Placard abuse will result in: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions

hasPart.name: When can you drive in a bike lane?

about.name: When can you drive in a bike lane?

hasPart.assesses: When can you drive in a bike lane? | When can you drive in a bike lane? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If there is a bike lane, drive into the bike lane no more than 200 feet before a turn. Watch for bicyclists or motorcyclists who may get between your vehicle and the curb.

suggestedAnswer.text: During rush hour traffic if there are no bicyclists in the bike lane.

comment.text: During rush hour traffic if there are no bicyclists in the bike lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right.

comment.text: When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right.

suggestedAnswer.text: When you want to pass a driver ahead of you who is turning right.

comment.text: When you want to pass a driver ahead of you who is turning right.

acceptedAnswer.text: When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right.

comment.text: When you are within 200 feet of a cross street where you plan to turn right.

answerExplanation.text: If there is a bike lane, drive into the bike lane no more than 200 feet before a turn. Watch for bicyclists or motorcyclists who may get between your vehicle and the curb.

comment.text: When can you drive in a bike lane? | If there is a bike lane, drive into the bike lane no more than 200 feet before a turn. Watch for bicyclists or motorcyclists who may get between your vehicle and the curb.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: When can you drive in a bike lane? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: When can you drive in a bike lane?
